Class LogWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • LogWriter
  • public class LogWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple LogWriter class backed by an ArrayList<String> to accumulate log entry strings. A log entry is the result of a query preformatted into a string. The query text itself can be included in the log too as text prepended to the entry and specifically formatted of clarity. The actual writing to a file is done by means of a dedicated method. Note that following a successful writing to a file all entries are deleted from the ArrayList and thus should be called at the very end of the program.
    See Also:
    addEntry(String, String), writeToLogFile(String)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LogWriter()
      Creates an new instance of LogWriter with an empty ArrayList of log entries.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogWriter

        public LogWriter()
        Creates an new instance of LogWriter with an empty ArrayList of log entries.

    • Method Detail

      • clearLog

        public void clearLog()
        Removes all entries from this LogWriter instance. Provided for the case when entry reset is needed without first writing all entries to file.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry​(java.lang.String entry)
        Appends an entry to this LogWriter's list of entries.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry string to appended to this LogWriter's list of entries

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry​(java.lang.String entry,
                     java.lang.String prependingText)
        Appends an entry to this LogWriter's list of entries prepended with the given text. Meant for including the query string in the log file like so: 
         LogWriter logWriter = new LogWriter();
 logwriter.addEntry(queryResult, queryText);
        For clarity, the prepended text will be indented and preceded with special characters: 
         +--
 | Query names: "lake", "Abbot", "Hill"
 +--
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry string to appended to this LogWriter's list of entries
        prependingText - the text that precedes the specified entry string

      • writeToLogFile

        public boolean writeToLogFile​(java.lang.String logFile)
        Writes all log entries to the specified log file, then clears all entries. If an exception is thrown while attempting to write to file, the entries will not be cleared.
        Parameters:
        logFile - the absolute path and name of the log file (e.g. C:\Users\Public\Documents\CGN_query-result_log.txt)
        Returns:
        true if writing to file was successful, or false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a formatted String representation of the entry list in this LogWriter Provided for debugging only (the returned String is not meant to be shown to the user).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
